Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that is healthy because it is getting enough water and light.
The student can draw a plant that is not healthy because it lacks water and light.
The student can show the difference between a well-watered plant and one without water by drawing the effects water has on plants.
The student can show the difference between a plant in light and one in darkness by drawing the effects of light on plants.
The student can illustrate patterns in how plants need both water and light in order to live and grow.
